name: Transformez les donn√©es Excel en vecteurs pr√™ts pour l'IA avec OpenAI et Supabase
description:
## Description
Ce flux de travail est une **solution pratique et ‚Äúsale‚Äù** pour des sc√©narios r√©els o√π les travailleurs de premi√®re ligne continuent d'utiliser Excel dans leurs processus quotidiens.  
Au lieu de forcer le changement, nous prenons leurs feuilles de calcul telles quelles, nettoyons et normalisons les donn√©es, g√©n√©rons des embeddings et stockons le tout dans Supabase.

Le b√©n√©fice : le personnel de premi√®re ligne continue avec ses outils familiers, tandis que **les analystes de donn√©es obtiennent des donn√©es propres, structur√©es et vectoris√©es** pr√™tes pour l'analyse ou les applications d'IA de type RAG.

## Comment √ßa fonctionne
- **Les travailleurs de premi√®re ligne continuent avec Excel** ‚Äì aucune interruption de leurs routines quotidiennes.  
- **T√©l√©charger & d√©clencher** ‚Äì Le flux de travail s'ex√©cute lorsqu'une nouvelle feuille Excel est pr√™te.  
- **Lire les lignes Excel** ‚Äì Les donn√©es sont extraites du classeur et de la feuille de calcul sp√©cifi√©s.  
- **Nettoyer & normaliser** ‚Äì Le HTML est supprim√©, les dates Excel sont corrig√©es et les champs de texte sont standardis√©s.  
- **Batch & switch** ‚Äì Les lignes sont divis√©es et achemin√©es dans des chemins de traitement Question/R√©ponse.  
- **G√©n√©rer des embeddings** ‚Äì Les Questions et R√©ponses nettoy√©es sont converties en vecteurs via OpenAI.  
- **Fusionner les enregistrements enrichis** ‚Äì Les donn√©es commerciales originales sont combin√©es avec les embeddings.  
- **√âcrire dans Supabase** ‚Äì Les donn√©es se retrouvent dans une table structur√©e (`excel_records`) avec des index vectoriels et FTS.  

## Pourquoi c'est ‚Äúsale mais utile‚Äù
- **Aucune interruption** ‚Äì les travailleurs de premi√®re ligne n'ont pas besoin de changer leur fa√ßon de travailler.  
- **Donn√©es pr√™tes pour les analystes** ‚Äì Supabase contient des donn√©es propres et interrogeables pour des tableaux de bord, des rapports ou des pipelines d'IA.  
- **Pont entre l'ancien et le nouveau** ‚Äì Excel reste l'entr√©e, mais le backend devient moderne et √©volutif.  
- **Modernisation incr√©mentale** ‚Äì ouvre la voie √† de futures mises √† niveau de flux de travail sans bloquer le travail actuel.  

## R√©sultat
Les travailleurs de premi√®re ligne conservent leurs flux de travail bas√©s sur Excel, tandis que **les donn√©es peuvent imm√©diatement √™tre structur√©es, recherchables et vectoris√©es dans Supabase** ‚Äî permettant une recherche, un reporting et une g√©n√©ration augment√©e par l'IA.


## Configuration requise

**Compte Supabase**
- Cr√©ez un projet et activez l'extension **pgvector**. 

**Cl√© API OpenAI** 
  - N√©cessaire pour g√©n√©rer des embeddings (`text-embedding-3-small`).  

**Identifiants Microsoft Excel**
  - N√©cessaires pour se connecter √† votre classeur et √† votre feuille de calcul.  

- ## Besoin d'aide
üîó [LinkedIn ‚Äì Wessel Bulte](https://www.linkedin.com/in/wessel-bulte/)

parameters.query:
-- ============================================
-- Prerequisites (needed for UUID + embeddings)
-- ============================================
-- gen_random_uuid() comes from pgcrypto
create extension if not exists pgcrypto;
-- vector type for embeddings (pgvector)
create extension if not exists vector;

-- ============================================
-- Recreate table (drop+create)
-- ============================================
drop table if exists public.excel_records cascade;

create table public.excel_records (
  -- Primary key + timestamps
  id                     uuid primary key default gen_random_uuid(),
  created_at             timestamptz not null default now(),
  updated_at             timestamptz not null default now(),

  -- Your original columns (names preserved)
  "UUID"                 text unique,
  "Projectcode"          text,
  "Bool_1"               boolean,
  "Bool_2"               boolean,
  "Bool_3"               boolean,
  "Handler"              text,
  "Status"               text,
  "Creation_date"        date,
  "Closed_on"            date,
  "City"                 text,

  -- Email with basic validation; keep the quoted name with dash
  "E-mailadres"          text
                         check ("E-mailadres" is null
                                or "E-mailadres" ~* '^[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\.[A-Za-z]{2,}$'),

  -- Q/A text (raw + cleaned variants)
  "Question"             text,
  "Question_clean"       text,
  "Answer"               text,
  "Answer_clean"         text,

  -- Embeddings (adjust the dimension if your model differs)
  "Question_embedding"   vector(1536),
  "Answer_embedding"     vector(1536),

  -- Full-text search (stored columns; we‚Äôll maintain them via triggers)
  "Question_fts"         tsvector,
  "Answer_fts"           tsvector
);

-- ============================================
-- Auto-maintain updated_at on UPDATE
-- ============================================
create or replace function public.excel_records_set_updated_at()
returns trigger language plpgsql as $$
begin
  new.updated_at := now();
  return new;
end$$;

drop trigger if exists excel_records_trg_set_updated_at on public.excel_records;
create trigger excel_records_trg_set_updated_at
before update on public.excel_records
for each row execute function public.excel_records_set_updated_at();

-- ============================================
-- Maintain FTS columns on INSERT/UPDATE
-- (uses 'simple' config; switch to 'dutch' if you prefer)
-- ============================================
create or replace function public.excel_records_fts_refresh()
returns trigger language plpgsql as $$
begin
  new."Question_fts" := to_tsvector('simple', coalesce(new."Question_clean", new."Question"));
  new."Answer_fts"   := to_tsvector('simple', coalesce(new."Answer_clean",   new."Answer"));
  return new;
end$$;

drop trigger if exists excel_records_trg_fts_ins on public.excel_records;
create trigger excel_records_trg_fts_ins
before insert on public.excel_records
for each row execute function public.excel_records_fts_refresh();

drop trigger if exists excel_records_trg_fts_upd on public.excel_records;
create trigger excel_records_trg_fts_upd
before update of "Question","Question_clean","Answer","Answer_clean" on public.excel_records
for each row execute function public.excel_records_fts_refresh();

-- ============================================
-- Indexes (FTS + embeddings + common filters)
-- ============================================
-- Full-text GIN indexes
create index if not exists excel_records_question_fts_gin
  on public.excel_records using gin ("Question_fts");
create index if not exists excel_records_answer_fts_gin
  on public.excel_records using gin ("Answer_fts");

-- Vector similarity (IVFFLAT with cosine distance)
-- Tip: performance improves after data is inserted and ANALYZE has run.
create index if not exists excel_records_question_vec_ivfflat
  on public.excel_records using ivfflat ("Question_embedding" vector_cosine_ops)
  with (lists = 100);
create index if not exists excel_records_answer_vec_ivfflat
  on public.excel_records using ivfflat ("Answer_embedding" vector_cosine_ops)
  with (lists = 100);

-- Helpful general indexes
create index if not exists excel_records_created_at_idx on public.excel_records (created_at);

-- ============================================
-- Row Level Security (RLS)
-- Enabled by default; deny-all until policies allow access.
-- ============================================
alter table public.excel_records enable row level security;

-- ---------- Default policy: server-side only ----------
-- This allows only the service role (server key) to read/write.
-- Use this if the table is NOT accessed directly from the client.
drop policy if exists excel_records_service_role_rw on public.excel_records;
create policy excel_records_service_role_rw
on public.excel_records
using (auth.role() = 'service_role')
with check (auth.role() = 'service_role');

-- ---------- OPTIONAL: per-user ownership ----------
-- If you want client access where each user sees only their own rows:
-- 1) Add an owner column:
--    alter table public.excel_records add column if not exists user_id uuid;
-- 2) Set it on insert from your app (or default to auth.uid()):
--    alter table public.excel_records alter column user_id set default auth.uid();
-- 3) Replace the policy set with:
--    drop policy if exists excel_records_service_role_rw on public.excel_records;
--    create policy excel_records_read_own  on public.excel_records for select using (user_id = auth.uid());
--    create policy excel_records_ins_own   on public.excel_records for insert with check (user_id = auth.uid());
--    create policy excel_records_upd_own   on public.excel_records for update using (user_id = auth.uid()) with check (user_id = auth.uid());
--    create policy excel_records_del_own   on public.excel_records for delete using (user_id = auth.uid());

-- ============================================
-- Notes / knobs you can tweak
-- ============================================
-- ‚Ä¢ Embedding size: change vector(1536) if your model uses a different dimension.
-- ‚Ä¢ FTS language: change 'simple' to 'dutch' in excel_records_fts_refresh() if preferred.
-- ‚Ä¢ After bulk inserts, run ANALYZE for best IVFFLAT performance:
--   analyze public.excel_records;

parameters.content:
## Simple upload from Excel to Supabase with RAG


### How it works:
- üñ±Ô∏è Trigger the workflow manually upon execution.
- üîç **Remove HTML** from the text input for cleaner data.
- üîÑ **Split Items** into manageable batches for processing.
- üîÄ Use **Switch** nodes to direct processing based on conditions.
- ‚ûï **Merge** items to consolidate data from previous steps.
- üìù Process **Questions** and **Answers** through coding nodes.
- üåê Utilize **HTTP Requests** to generate embeddings from OpenAI for both questions and answers.
- üóÇÔ∏è Write structured entries into a database (e.g., Supabase).
- üì• **Retrieve Existing Rows** for updates or comparisons.
- üìä Build tables in Supabase for organized storage.

### Parameters to configure:
- API keys for OpenAI and Supabase.
- Paths/settings for database and text files.
- URL endpoints if using external APIs.

### Limitations / Gotchas:
- HTML may not always be completely stripped; double-check output.
- Ensure APIs are responsive to avoid unexpected delays.
- Check database schema compatibility before writing rows.

### Expected result
A cleanly structured database containing documentation entries, allowing easy retrieval and management of workflow insights.

nodes.name: Sticky Note - Write row to database

parameters.content:
## üìÅ Write Row to Database 

### üéØ Purpose
This node is designed to insert a new row into the specified database table, specifically for logging or documenting data related to projects.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - Various data fields (UUID, Projectcode, Bool values, Handler, Status, Creation date, Closed on, E-mailadres, City, Question, Answer, and Embeddings).
- **Outputs:** 
  - Confirmation of the row being added successfully or an error message if the insertion fails.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Table ID:** 
  - Set to `"excel_records"`, indicating the target table in the database where the new row will be inserted.
- **Field Values:** 
  - Configure each field by mapping JSON data:
    - **UUID**: Unique identifier for the record.
    - **Projectcode**: Code associated with the project.
    - **Bool_1, Bool_2, Bool_3**: Boolean flags for various purposes.
    - **Handler**: Assigned handler for the project.
    - **Status**: Current status of the project.
    - **Creation_date**: Date when the entry was created.
    - **Closed_on**: Date when the project was closed.
    - **E-mailadres**: Contact email.
    - **City**: Location associated with the project.
    - **Question**: Input question.
    - **Question_clean**: Clean version of the input question.
    - **Answer**: Response to the question.
    - **Answer_clean**: Clean version of the response.
    - **Question_embedding**: Numeric representation of the question.
    - **Answer_embedding**: Numeric representation of the answer.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Verify the structure and spelling of JSON keys to ensure data is appropriately mapped to the database fields.
- Ensure that the Supabase credentials are valid and have permission to write to the specified table.
- Monitor for database constraints (like unique keys) that could prevent successful data insertion.

nodes.name: Sticky Note - Merge fields for database insert

parameters.content:
## üìÅ Merge Fields for Database Insert 

### üéØ Purpose
Merge different fields into a structured format for inserting data into a database, specifically handling original data and embeddings from OpenAI responses.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - Original data from a loop containing UUID.
  - OpenAI HTTP response with embeddings for questions and answers.
- **Outputs:** 
  - Merged JSON object including an ID, original data, question embeddings, and answer embeddings for seamless database insertion.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **jsCode:**
  - The JavaScript code block processes incoming inputs, distinguishes between original data and embeddings, and formats them for database insertion.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure the correct structure of incoming data, particularly that UUID is present and that embeddings are distinctly identified.
- Verify the number of inputs to ensure that embeddings are managed correctly; otherwise, one will be overwritten.

## Merge

### Purpose
Combine the multiple input data streams into a single output.

## ü§ñ Embeddings OpenAI Question & Answer 

### üéØ Purpose
This node communicates with the OpenAI API to generate embeddings for a given text input, allowing for further processing in workflows related to natural language understanding.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - Text to be embedded as specified by `{{ $json.text_to_embed }}`.
- **Outputs:** 
  - Returns the numeric embeddings of the input text in the specified format (float).

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Method:** 
  - POST (specifies the HTTP method for the API request).
- **URL:** 
  - `https://api.openai.com/v1/embeddings` (the endpoint for generating embeddings).
- **Authentication:** 
  - Uses predefined credentials for API access (configured as `openAiApi`).
- **JSON Body Configuration:** 
  - Includes:
    - **Model:** `"text-embedding-3-small"` (indicates the embedding model to use).
    - **Input:** `{{ $json.text_to_embed }}` (the text input for which embeddings are required).
    - **Encoding Format:** `"float"` (desired output format for the embeddings).

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure that your API credentials are correctly configured to avoid authentication errors.
- Validate the text input to ensure it is a string; embedding generation on invalid inputs may result in errors.
- Monitor the API usage limits to avoid hitting rate limits imposed by OpenAI's API.

## üí° Code "Question" 

### üéØ Purpose
This node processes the "Customer Question" field from input data, checking for specific conditions before preparing the information for further use, such as sending it to OpenAI.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - Customer data containing fields like `has_Question` and `Question_clean`.
- **Outputs:** 
  - A JSON object comprising the `record_id`, the cleaned question text (`text_to_embed`), and the original item if the conditions are met; otherwise, it returns an empty array.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **jsCode:** 
  - This field contains the JavaScript code responsible for processing the data. No additional configuration parameters are necessary.

### üìù Tip / Gotchas
- Ensure the input data includes the necessary fields (`has_Question` and `Question_clean`) to avoid returning an empty output.
- If either condition to process the `Customer Question` is not met, the node will simply return an empty array, resulting in no further processing downstream.
- Use meaningful field names in the original data to clearly identify the required fields for better maintenance and understanding.

## üìÅ Code "Answer" 

### üéØ Purpose
Process the Customer Answer field from the input data and prepare it for further embedding with OpenAI. It ensures that only valid answers are sent without additional metadata.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - JSON object that may contain fields like `has_Answer` and `Answer_clean`.
- **Outputs:** 
  - A JSON object containing the `text_to_embed`, which is the cleaned answer text ready for embedding.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **jsCode:** 
  - JavaScript code snippet that checks the presence of `has_Answer` and `Answer_clean` fields before sending the answer for embedding.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure that the input object contains both `has_Answer` and `Answer_clean` fields to avoid returning an empty array.
- If either field is not present or valid, the node will skip processing and output an empty array. Make sure to validate data before feeding it to this node.

## ü™Ñ Switch 

### üéØ Purpose
The Switch node is used to evaluate conditions and determine the execution path based on provided rules, allowing for conditional logic in your workflow.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:**
  - JSON data containing properties for evaluation, such as `has_Question` and `has_Answer`.
- **Outputs:**
  - Routes the workflow based on matched conditions, outputting either `Question` or `Answer` based on the input properties.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Rules:**
  - Define conditions to evaluate:
    - **Question Output:**
      - Triggers if `has_Question` is `true`.
    - **Answer Output:**
      - Triggers if `has_Answer` is not empty.
- **Rename Output:**
  - Specify an output key name (`Question` or `Answer`) to route the matching output.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure that the input JSON has the properties being evaluated (`has_Question`, `has_Answer`) to avoid unexpected behavior.
- Check the conditions‚Äô operators and values are correctly defined for accurate branching of the workflow.
- Use the **allMatchingOutputs** option if you want the node to send multiple outputs simultaneously if multiple conditions are met.

## üîÑ Loop Over Items 

###  Purpose
Iterate through teh new database entry to inser them 1 by 1

## üóëÔ∏è Remove HTML

### üéØ Purpose
This node cleans and normalizes data extracted from Excel files by removing HTML tags and entities from specified text fields.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - A list of items, each containing fields like 'Question', 'Answer', 'Creation Date', and 'Closed on'.
- **Outputs:** 
  - A cleaned version of the original items with HTML removed and dates formatted.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Features
- **HTML Removal:**
  - Strips HTML tags and replaces HTML entities with spaces in both 'Question' and 'Answer' fields.
- **Date Formatting:**
  - Converts Excel date formats into standard ISO format for 'Creation Date' and 'Closed on' fields.
- **Cleaned Fields:**
  - Produces 'Question_clean' and 'Answer_clean' fields for further processing.

### üìù Gotchas
- Ensure that fields 'Question' and 'Answer' exist before processing to avoid undefined errors.
- The cleaning process includes collapsing multiple spaces and trimming whitespace, which may affect data formatting.
- This node processes all items in the input array, so ensure it receives the correct data types.

### üîß Configuration Parameters
- No additional configuration parameters are required other than providing the correct input data structure.

## üîó Merge Import Data 

### üéØ Purpose
Combine two datasets based on matching UUIDs while retaining non-matching entries from the first input.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - Two data sets to be merged, referred to as "input1" and "input2."
- **Outputs:** 
  - A single dataset that includes all records from "input1" and merges matching records from "input2."

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Mode:** 
  - Set to "combine" to merge datasets.
- **Fields to Match String:** 
  - Specify the field used for matching entries (e.g., "UUID").
- **Join Mode:** 
  - Keep non-matching entries from "input1" even if there‚Äôs no corresponding match in "input2."
- **Output Data From:** 
  - Select the source for the output data, here specified as "input1."
  
### üìù Tip / Gotchas
- Make sure the UUID field is present in both datasets for effective merging.
- Verify data types of the UUID field are consistent across both inputs to ensure proper matching.
- Review the output to ensure that it reflects the desired dataset accurately, with non-matching entries retained from the first input.

## üìÅ Retrieve Existing Rows 

### üéØ Purpose
Retrieve all existing rows from the specified table in Supabase for use in further automation workflows.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - None specific; this node retrieves data directly.
- **Outputs:** 
  - A list of records from the `excel_records` table.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Operation:**
  - Set to `getAll` to fetch all rows from the table.
- **Table ID:**
  - Specify the ID of the table. Here, it is set to `excel_records`.
- **Return All:**
  - Set to `true` to bring back all records without any filtering.
- **Filter Type:**
  - Set to `none` indicating that no filters are applied to the data retrieval.

### üìù Tip / Gotchas
- Ensure your Supabase account is correctly set up and connected to avoid authentication failures when accessing the database.
- Retrieving a large number of rows may lead to performance issues; consider using filters if applicable.
- Any changes made to the data in the table after this node runs won't be reflected in its output until the node is run again.

nodes.name: Sticky Note - Get rows from sheet

parameters.content:
## üìÑ Get Rows from Sheet 

### üéØ Purpose
Retrieve rows from a specified worksheet in an Excel workbook to automate data extraction for documentation or processing.

### üîÑ Inputs / Outputs
- **Inputs:** 
  - Workbook ID and worksheet ID to identify which data to read.
- **Outputs:** 
  - Rows of data extracted from the specified Excel sheet.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Key Fields to Configure
- **Resource:** 
  - Set to "worksheet" to indicate the node operates on a worksheet.
- **Operation:** 
  - Use "readRows" to specify that you want to retrieve data from the worksheet.
- **Workbook:** 
  - Provide the ID of the workbook (`01VJX45VT23GD6IE3HAVD3GBYREFIPIRAO`) to read from.
- **Worksheet:** 
  - Specify the ID of the desired worksheet (`{94B58D19-7964-4A20-BFF2-BBE769717A5B}`) to extract data from.

### üìù Tip / Validation
- Ensure that the provided workbook and worksheet IDs are correct and accessible via the configured Microsoft Excel account to avoid permission or data retrieval errors.
- Check the extracted data format to ensure compatibility with downstream nodes in your workflow.

## Adjust the column schema in both Supabase and Excel to match your requirements.
## This example uses the following fields:

Excel:
- UUID
- Projectcode
- Bool 1
- Bool 2
- Bool 3
- Handler
- Status
- Creation Date
- Closed on
- E-mailadres
- City
- Question
- Answer

## Use the Postgres node or copy/past the sql 
## The SQL: 

-- ============================================
-- Prerequisites (needed for UUID + embeddings)
-- ============================================
-- gen_random_uuid() comes from pgcrypto
create extension if not exists pgcrypto;
-- vector type for embeddings (pgvector)
create extension if not exists vector;

-- ============================================
-- Recreate table (drop+create)
-- ============================================
drop table if exists public.excel_records cascade;

create table public.excel_records (
  -- Primary key + timestamps
  id                     uuid primary key default gen_random_uuid(),
  created_at             timestamptz not null default now(),
  updated_at             timestamptz not null default now(),

  -- Your original columns (names preserved)
  "UUID"                 text unique,
  "Projectcode"          text,
  "Bool_1"               boolean,
  "Bool_2"               boolean,
  "Bool_3"               boolean,
  "Handler"              text,
  "Status"               text,
  "Creation_date"        date,
  "Closed_on"            date,
  "City"                 text,

  -- Email with basic validation; keep the quoted name with dash
  "E-mailadres"          text
                         check ("E-mailadres" is null
                                or "E-mailadres" ~* '^[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\.[A-Za-z]{2,}$'),

  -- Q/A text (raw + cleaned variants)
  "Question"             text,
  "Question_clean"       text,
  "Answer"               text,
  "Answer_clean"         text,

  -- Embeddings (adjust the dimension if your model differs)
  "Question_embedding"   vector(1536),
  "Answer_embedding"     vector(1536),

  -- Full-text search (stored columns; we‚Äôll maintain them via triggers)
  "Question_fts"         tsvector,
  "Answer_fts"           tsvector
);

-- ============================================
-- Auto-maintain updated_at on UPDATE
-- ============================================
create or replace function public.excel_records_set_updated_at()
returns trigger language plpgsql as $$
begin
  new.updated_at := now();
  return new;
end$$;

drop trigger if exists excel_records_trg_set_updated_at on public.excel_records;
create trigger excel_records_trg_set_updated_at
before update on public.excel_records
for each row execute function public.excel_records_set_updated_at();

-- ============================================
-- Maintain FTS columns on INSERT/UPDATE
-- (uses 'simple' config; switch to 'dutch' if you prefer)
-- ============================================
create or replace function public.excel_records_fts_refresh()
returns trigger language plpgsql as $$
begin
  new."Question_fts" := to_tsvector('simple', coalesce(new."Question_clean", new."Question"));
  new."Answer_fts"   := to_tsvector('simple', coalesce(new."Answer_clean",   new."Answer"));
  return new;
end$$;

drop trigger if exists excel_records_trg_fts_ins on public.excel_records;
create trigger excel_records_trg_fts_ins
before insert on public.excel_records
for each row execute function public.excel_records_fts_refresh();

drop trigger if exists excel_records_trg_fts_upd on public.excel_records;
create trigger excel_records_trg_fts_upd
before update of "Question","Question_clean","Answer","Answer_clean" on public.excel_records
for each row execute function public.excel_records_fts_refresh();

-- ============================================
-- Indexes (FTS + embeddings + common filters)
-- ============================================
-- Full-text GIN indexes
create index if not exists excel_records_question_fts_gin
  on public.excel_records using gin ("Question_fts");
create index if not exists excel_records_answer_fts_gin
  on public.excel_records using gin ("Answer_fts");

-- Vector similarity (IVFFLAT with cosine distance)
-- Tip: performance improves after data is inserted and ANALYZE has run.
create index if not exists excel_records_question_vec_ivfflat
  on public.excel_records using ivfflat ("Question_embedding" vector_cosine_ops)
  with (lists = 100);
create index if not exists excel_records_answer_vec_ivfflat
  on public.excel_records using ivfflat ("Answer_embedding" vector_cosine_ops)
  with (lists = 100);

-- Helpful general indexes
create index if not exists excel_records_created_at_idx on public.excel_records (created_at);

-- ============================================
-- Row Level Security (RLS)
-- Enabled by default; deny-all until policies allow access.
-- ============================================
alter table public.excel_records enable row level security;

-- ---------- Default policy: server-side only ----------
-- This allows only the service role (server key) to read/write.
-- Use this if the table is NOT accessed directly from the client.
drop policy if exists excel_records_service_role_rw on public.excel_records;
create policy excel_records_service_role_rw
on public.excel_records
using (auth.role() = 'service_role')
with check (auth.role() = 'service_role');

-- ---------- OPTIONAL: per-user ownership ----------
-- If you want client access where each user sees only their own rows:
-- 1) Add an owner column:
--    alter table public.excel_records add column if not exists user_id uuid;
-- 2) Set it on insert from your app (or default to auth.uid()):
--    alter table public.excel_records alter column user_id set default auth.uid();
-- 3) Replace the policy set with:
--    drop policy if exists excel_records_service_role_rw on public.excel_records;
--    create policy excel_records_read_own  on public.excel_records for select using (user_id = auth.uid());
--    create policy excel_records_ins_own   on public.excel_records for insert with check (user_id = auth.uid());
--    create policy excel_records_upd_own   on public.excel_records for update using (user_id = auth.uid()) with check (user_id = auth.uid());
--    create policy excel_records_del_own   on public.excel_records for delete using (user_id = auth.uid());

-- ============================================
-- Notes / knobs you can tweak
-- ============================================
-- ‚Ä¢ Embedding size: change vector(1536) if your model uses a different dimension.
-- ‚Ä¢ FTS language: change 'simple' to 'dutch' in excel_records_fts_refresh() if preferred.
-- ‚Ä¢ After bulk inserts, run ANALYZE for best IVFFLAT performance:
--   analyze public.excel_records;
